title: [Large-scale] Continuous Mathematical Problem Solving and Proof Competency Development through Digital Learning Space Experiences

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary math concepts (arithmetic, geometry, basic algebra) and primary education practical experience, ability to express basic formulas and interpret graphs
context.additional_context: Emphasizes the competency of practicing elementary teachers to continuously utilize digital learning spaces in smartphone-centric limited environments, enhancing students' computational skills, problem-solving abilities, and mathematical proof capabilities. Focuses on fostering mathematical modeling and data analysis skills for solving real-life problems.

learning_goals: Learners develop variational analysis and logical discussion skills by sharing weekly math problem-solving processes and formula application cases at least three times per week via asynchronous learning platforms
Learners maintain over 80% attendance combining synchronous (live) and asynchronous (recorded) lectures while improving equation-solving, graph interpretation, and statistical analysis skills
Learners complete digital math education design projects (e.g., probability game development), receive peer evaluations, and validate problem-solving strategies

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
